column4: Has anyone had any luck with legacy ATI drivers and recent ubuntu? or am I just screwed...
- what kind of ati card do you have?
Radeon X850 pro
the legacy drivers for linux from ATI won't install on 10.04 or 10.10
the site says they are not supported for any distro post feb 2009
- if you go to System -> Administration -> Addition Drivers (Hardware drivers for 10.04) does it find a driver for your card?
nope
- ok, do you receive an error when installing the drivers from ati's site?
- there's a few commands we can run to have it build it for the current distro
yes the error I get is as follows
Error: ./default_policy.sh does not support version
default:v2:i686:lib::none:2.6.35-22-generic; make sure that the version is being
correctly set by --iscurrentdistro
sorry =(
- try this run the command to run the ati file but put this at the end: --buildpkg Ubuntu/maverick
nope. I tried with --listpkg and the highest it mentions is 9.04
- hmm... what debians do you have listed?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/514628/
- try this: ./ati... --buildpkg Ubuntu/source
hmmm that may not work Mossyfunk
synaptic is installing a bunch off packages including gcc and binutils
- ok this  may work, hold on
